content:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/data/set/pointwise.html defines these two “derived“ actions:

  • s • t: Scalar multiplication, set of all x • y where x ∈ s and y ∈ t.
  • a • s: Scaling, set of all a • x where x ∈ s.

I see s • (t₁ ∪ t₂) = s • t₁ ∪ s • t₂ for the former (https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib_docs/data/set/pointwise.html#set.smul_union), but not for the latter (or at least some lemma about s • (t₁ ∪ t₂).

Am I looking in the wrong place, or is it missing? In my case • is a mul_action of a group on a set.
The (weird) rule is that s • t is smul and a • s is smul_set.
Ok, thanks, I must have been blind. I thought I Ctrl-F “union” through that file multiple times.
Joachim Breitner has marked this topic as resolved.
